The attack extended from FORT DE LA P0HPELLE to VRIGHY. This attack was carried out by 3 divisions, who, according to statements from prisoners, had orders to take RHEJkS at all costs. These attacks were completely repulsed. In the neighbourhood of SILLERY the enemy made some progress but the situation was completely restored by a counter-attack.On the British Front the situation is unchanged.2. ITALIAN FRONT.No news has yet been received of any fighting later than the morning of the 18th June. Yesterday1s air report, timed 1,20 pcm0, states that the PIaVE is in heavy flood and that the only bridges remaining between VIDOR and the sea are three at SAN DONA (1 of which is incomplete) and one (incomplete) at SALGAREDA, According to Italian Staff the river is unfordable.General staff,War Office, S.W.I. 19th June, 1918,Issued at 6,40 p.m.is the Property ofs Cr/ernnierrt12'301
